data.title: Under a new law, Indonesia will plant microchips on all its convicted child rapists so that they can be monitored at all times. It will also impose chemical castration for convicted pedophiles and child rapists.
Monsanto Linked to Tax Havens in Panama Papers Leak
Radio-backed campaign pushes for FM access on your smartphone

India's top court ordered state governments to provide free meals to schoolchildren during summer break as country reels from impact of one of worst droughts on record. Free lunches are offered to some 120 million students in what is world's largest school feeding program, but not during holidays.
Manchester United's Old Trafford ground evacuated
Human rights activists project 'Daesh Bank' onto Saudi Arabia's embassy in Berlin

Sinkhole discovery suggests humans were in Florida 14,500 years ago: Knife, bone, and dung cast doubt on Bering Strait theory and indicate humans spread through Americas 1,500 years earlier than thought, researchers say
Heat wave hits Egypt, temperatures reach 45 degrees
Suicide bombing in Yemen kills 25 people
Thousands of South African gold miners launch a multi-million-dollar class action lawsuit against mining companies over deadly lung diseases.
Judge in Iran tells prisoner: 'If you're innocent you'll go to heaven after you're hanged'
Armed US air marshal 'removed from plane at Heathrow and arrested by police after captain smelled alcohol on his breath'
Student in Turkey accused of terror propaganda for speaking Kurdish
Mark Zuckerberg claims 'no evidence' of political bias at Facebook
Pro-life marches across Poland: Demonstrations in over 140 cities, signatures collected for a so-called citizen’s bill calling for a complete ban on abortion.
